fields.Title of Intellectual Property: 62701335 - Application of Optically-Gated Transistor as a Memristor Selector Switch
fields.Description/Abstract:
An optically activated switch comprising amorphous material which can be used to isolate and control
access to a circuit. The optically activated switch can be used as an access transistor or selector device
for a resistive or memristive memory element. It can also be used as an optically gated amplifier, and as
a wavelength converter device. The device has a saturation current magnitude dependent on the incident
light intensity and wavelength. The saturation current can be used to program a memristor or resistive
memory element to continuous states. In some embodiments, the phototransistor or detector may
include optically-gated transistors (OGTs), fabricated using doped amorphous GeSe films designed with
high selectivity and used in a circuit to access and program the memristor device. In some embodiments,
the device can be used to program a large array with an optical pattern.
